pr_title: #3171 Support for futures markets in orders

timeline.message:
#3171 Unfortunatley I had to refactor two xchange implmetations a little
for correct json deserialisation.

#3171 couple of xchange implementations calling order builders directly
and need casting to CurrencyPair

timeline.bodyText:
first of all is this needed here for the Instrument refactor to work?
secondly you should not write deserializer for DTOs that can be easily deserialized by Jackson it self if you just use Jacksons annotations properly
timeline.author: walec51

replies.bodyText:
Hi Adam,
The issue I was struggling with, if we leave it as is we have:
`@JsonNaming(PropertyNamingStrategy.SnakeCaseStrategy.class)
public class TheRockTicker {
@JsonDeserialize(using = CurrencyPairDeserializer.class)
private CurrencyPair fundId`
But when we go to deserialize it, jackson cannot work out the type for fundId as CurrencyPair.
com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.exc.InvalidTypeIdException:  Missing type id when trying to resolve subtype of [simple type, class org.knowm.xchange.currency.CurrencyPair]: missing type id property 'type' (for POJO property 'fund_id')
Thought the JsonDeserialize annotation would have resolved the type, but it did not. So I tried to force it to use the CurrencyPairDeserializer by having a custom deserializer. Suggestions welcomed on which annotation might work.
replies.author: douggie

replies.bodyText:
yes and that is because these annotations:
@JsonTypeInfo(use = JsonTypeInfo.Id.NAME, include = JsonTypeInfo.As.PROPERTY, property = "type")
@JsonSubTypes({@Type(value = CurrencyPair.class, name = "currencyPair")})

on Instrument which currently make no sense if we serialize / deserialize CurrencyPair as a string
a string will never have a property type - we will probably have to have a custom deserializer for Insturment to determine its concrete class
I see you have already provided one InstrumentDeserializer - which is better then having a custom deserializer for every DTO that uses the Insturment class - this would be a show stopper for this refactor
for now remove those annotation
we also must think how will we serialize / deserialize derivatives
in your InstrumentDeserializer you detect if the string is a currency pair based on the number of / characters - that is ok
but how will we distinguish futures from options? could you give some examples how their ticker symbols look on exchanges?
replies.author: walec51

replies.bodyText:
Thanks so much for suggestions, yeah a customer deserializer seems the way to go.
It is not ideal, but deserialising from strings we can count the /
CurrencyPair (Base/Counter)
BTC/USD
Futures/Swaps (Base/Counter/Prompt)
BTC/USD/200925
Options (Base/Counter/Prompt/StrikePrice/Put?Call)
BTC/USD/22MAR20/5375/C
Examples
Okex Futures
BTC-USD-200925
Kraken Futures
fi_xbtusd_180615
Derbit options
BTC-22MAR20-5375-C
